ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with multiple cafe-au-lait spots and freckling (particularly axillary/inguinal). Pulmonic stenosis occurs in ~2% of NF1 patients as part of NF1 vasculopathy.
Presents with cafe-au-lait spots and freckling similar to NF1 but typically milder. Cardiac involvement is less common but can occur.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Noonan syndrome with multiple lentigines (LEOPARD syndrome)
ranked_diseases.explanation: Features multiple lentigines (can resemble freckling), cafe-au-lait spots, and pulmonic stenosis as a cardinal feature. Age is appropriate for lentiginosis development.
RASopathy that can present with cafe-au-lait spots, cardiac defects including pulmonic stenosis, and skin abnormalities. Less typical presentation without other features.
Common RASopathy with pulmonic stenosis as frequent finding. Cafe-au-lait spots occur in ~10% of cases, freckling less common but possible.
Allelic variant of NF1 with cafe-au-lait spots, pulmonic stenosis as a key feature. However, typically includes cognitive impairment not mentioned here.
